channel.title: Phishing on jhead.blog
channel.description: Recent content in Phishing on jhead.blog

item.title: Initial Access: Spearphishing Example
item.description: In the MITRE ATT&CK Framework, which classifies and creates chains of events for certain kinds of hacker behavior, Initial Access is one of the first tactics used in an attack. It’s sort of self-explanatory—it describes how the attacker first got into a system. I’m just learning about these concepts, so I wanted to start from the beginning. I’m interested in a few techniques, and I’ll go over them in my next few posts.
